text: The 5th Army Corps () is a military unit of Armenian Army.https://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/armenia/army-orbat.htm The 5th Army Corps was formed in 1998. The commander of the army corps is Andranik Piloyan (since 18 June 2018 Նոր նշանակումներ Զինված ուժերում). ==Structure== The corps consists of two fortified regions, the 4th independent motor rifle regiment, and the 545th independent rifle regiment.https://istiglal.com/tag/5-%D0%B9-%D0%B0%D0%BA-%D0%B2%D1%81-%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%BC%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%B8%D0%B8/ It also has reconnaissance, tank, and artillery battalions as well as self- propelled artillery and rear battalions. Units from the corps are stationed close to the Armenian-Turkish border.https://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/armenia/army.htm Together with the Russian 102nd Military Base, the corps makes up the United Group of Forces,https://fip.am/en/174 set up in 2000 by President Robert Kocharyan and President Vladimir Putin.https://www.cacianalyst.org/publications/analytical- articles/item/13416-russia-and-armenia-establish-joint-ground-forces.html Units of the corps took part in the 2020 Armenian–Azerbaijani skirmishes. ==Commanders== *Major General Seyran Ohanyan (1998-1999) *Major General Karen Abrahamyan (13 November 2015-28 September 2017) *Major General Artak Davtyan (28 September 2017Արտակ Դավթյանը նշանակվել է ՊՆ 5-րդ բանակային կորպուսի հրամանատար-24 May 2018Արտակ Դավթյան. ՀՀ ՊՆ) *Major General Andranik Piloyan (since 18 June 2018) ==References== Category:Military units and formations of Armenia Category:Corps by country Category:Military units and formations established in 1998
title: 5th Army Corps (Armenia)
